Issues.Body: Since it's a developer tool, it would be nice to have dark mode in the documentation website. It's already in https://material.angular.io. So it should be expanded to the main documentation as well. The current website burns my eyes.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add dark mode to angular.io" (#40102)

Issues.Title: feat(compiler-cli): JIT compilation of directive declarations
Issues.Body:
The `…µ…µngDeclareDirective` calls are designed to be translated to fully
AOT compiled code during a build transform, but in cases this is not
done it is still possible to compile the declaration object in the
browser using the JIT compiler. This commit adds a runtime
implementation of `…µ…µngDeclareDirective` which invokes the JIT compiler
using the declaration object, such that a compiled directive definition
is made available to the Ivy runtime.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(compiler-cli): JIT compilation of directive declarations" (#40101)

Issues.Title: feat(dev-infra): support --mode flag for building environment stamp
Issues.Body:
When building the environment stamp, support two modes: release and snapshot

The release mode will always stamp using the current version of in the root package.json
and in snapshot mode will use a version stamp expressing a version based on the tag and
the number of commits from the tag.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(dev-infra): support --mode flag for building environment stamp " (#40095)

Issues.Title: test(compiler-cli): fix i18n error tests
Issues.Body:
Refactors the i18n error tests to be unit tests in ngtsc_spec.ts. There
is two reasons for doing this.

First is that the tests in compliace_old expected an expection to be be
thrown but did not fail the test if no exception was thrown. That means
that this test could miss catching a bug. It is also a big hacky to call
compile directly and expect an exception to be thrown for diagnostics.

Also, this can easily be unit tested and an end-to-end test is not
necessary since we are not making use of the goldfiles for these tests.

It is easier to maintain and less hacky to validate that we get helpful
error messages when nesting i18n sections by calling getDiagnostics
directly.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "test(compiler-cli): fix i18n error tests" (#40072)

Issues.Title: fix(dev-infra): add vim .swp files to gitignore

The vim editor produces temporarily files that can end in both .swo and

commit temporary files.

Issues.Title: fix(language-service): force compileNonExportedClasses: false in LS
Issues.Body:
Projects opened in the LS are often larger in scope than the compilation
units seen by the compiler when actually building. For example, in the LS
it's not uncommon for the project to include both application as well as
test files. This can create issues when the combination of files results
in errors that are not otherwise present - for example, if test files
have inline NgModules that re-declare components (a common Angular pattern).
Such code is valid when compiling the app only (test files are excluded, so
only one declaration is seen by the compiler) or when compiling tests only
(since tests run in JIT mode and are not seen by the AOT compiler), but when
both sets of files are mixed into a single compilation unit, the compiler
sees the double declaration as an error.

This commit attempts to mitigate the problem by forcing the compiler flag
`compileNonExportedClasses` to `false` in a LS context. When tests contain
duplicate declarations, often such declarations are inline in specs and not
exported from the top level, so this flag can be used to greatly improve the
IDE experience.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(language-service): force compileNonExportedClasses: false in LS" (#40092)

Issues.Title: fix(core): `QueryList` does not fire changes if the underlying list did not change.
Issues.Body:
Previous implementation would fire changes `QueryList.changes.subscribe`
even if underlying list did not change. Such situation can arise if a
`LView` is inserted or removed, causing `QueryList` to recompute, but
the recompute results in the same exact `QueryList` result. In such
a case we don't want to fire a change event (as there is no change.)

Issues.Title: Router shallowEqual util throws error in IE
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? No ### Description I can't get this to reproduce locally, but our logs show that users using IE and Edge are getting an error message of "Object expected" on line [29 of collection.ts](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/router/src/utils/collection.ts#L29). This indicates that the second object being passed into the shallowEqual is not an object. The call is coming from [updateSegmentGroup](https://source.corp.google.com/piper///depot/google3/third_party/javascript/angular2/rc/packages/router/src/create_url_tree.ts;l=197?q=updateSegmentGroupChildren&ct=os&sq=package:piper%20file:%2F%2Fdepot%2Fgoogle3%20-file:google3%2Fexperimental) which calls prefixedWith which calls shallowEqual. It seems like additional checks in compare to ensure that the two objects being passed to shallowEqual are in fact objects should resolve this issue. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction The errors are from logs so I don't have a reliable way to reproduce the issue, but we are seeing many reports of this error. ## üî• Exception or Error 



Object expected
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** We run with the latest version of Angular. The errors from today were probably cut from an Angular version a week or two ago. **Anything else relevant?** This only occurs in Edge and IE as far as we can tell.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Router shallowEqual util throws error in IE" (#40090)

Issues.Title: Support children outlet in wildcard route
Issues.Body: I'm trying to make the following route config work: ```javascript { path: '**', component: PageComponent, children: [ { path: ':slug', outlet: 'section', component: SectionComponent } ] }, ``` And this in the `PageComponent`: ```html Section One ``` As of Angular 11, the outlet doesn't work under a wildcard. Using `routerLink` in `PageComponent` generates the proper link, but it doesn't navigate anywhere when clicked, meaning the URL doesn't change, and the router-outlet doesn't get populated. The idea is to have a route with unlimited dynamic nested pages where each page can have a section outlet, like: `/:page/[:page]/(section:[:slug])` Could this be supported? Is there any workaround I can use?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Support children outlet in wildcard route" (#40089)

Issues.Title: ci: reduce flakiness of docs-infra `deploy-to-firebase.js` tests
Issues.Body:
The `deploy-to-firebase.js` tests rely on git info retrieved from the `angular/angular` repository (via `git ls-remote ...`).

Previously, different calls to `git ls-remote` could return different values if a new commit was pushed or a new branch was created during test execution, resulting in errors ([example CI failure][1]).

This commit makes the tests more stable by memoizing the result of `git ls-remote` and returning the same result for subsequent calls with the same arguments (even if meanwhile the remote has been updated).

[1]: https://circleci.com/gh/angular/angular/877626
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "ci: reduce flakiness of docs-infra `deploy-to-firebase.js` tests" (#40088)

Issues.Title: refactor(core): express trusted constants with tagged template literals
Issues.Body:
The trustConstantHtml and trustConstantResourceUrl functions are only
meant to be passed constant strings extracted from Angular application
templates, as passing other strings or variables could introduce XSS
vulnerabilities.

To better protect these APIs, turn them into template tags. This makes
it possible to assert that the associated template literals do not
contain any interpolation, and thus must be constant.

Issues.Title: fix(compiler): avoid duplicate i18n blocks for i18n attrs on elements with structural directives
Issues.Body:
Currently when `…µ…µtemplate` and `…µ…µelement` instructions are generated by compiler, all static attributes are
duplicated for both instructions. As a part of this duplication, i18n translation blocks for static i18n attributes
are generated twice as well, causing duplicate entries in extracted translation files (when Ivy extraction mechanisms
are used). This commit fixes this issue by introducing a cache for i18n translation blocks (for static attributes
only).

Also this commit further aligns `…µ…µtemplate` and `…µ…µelement` instruction attributes, which should help implement
more effective attributes deduplication logic.

Closes #39942.

Issues.Title: Reactive Forms rules for name and formControlName matching causes conflicts with radio sets in different FormGroup/FormArray sections
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/forms ### Is this a regression? No ### Description When using Reactive Forms and radio buttons, an error is logged indicating that the `name` and `formControlName` attributes must match, even for radios inside of `FormGroup` or `FormArray`. Following this rule causes the HTML form to treat *all* radio buttons with the same property name as part of the same radio set, even those in distinct FormGroups or FormArray elements. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction This example demonstrates behavior when following the rule that name and formControlName must match for radio buttons: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-sa7e9m?devtoolsheight=33&file=src/app/app.component.html **Expected:** The `type` radio buttons oustide of the `meta` FormGroup should be in a different set than the `type` radio buttons in the `meta` FormGroup, such independent selections can be made in each set. No errors are logged. **Actual:** The radio buttons are in the same set since they have the same name, such that if the user selects a `type` radio in the `meta` FormGroup than it de-selects all `type` radios outside of the `meta` FormGroup and vice versa. No errors are logged. **Expected:** Each book in the `books` FormArray should have an independent set of `status` radio buttons, such that independent selections can be made for each book. No errors are logged. **Actual:** The radio buttons for all books are in the same set since they have the same name, such that if the user selects a `status` radio in one book then the form de-selects all `status` radios for all other books. No errors are logged. --- This example demonstrates behavior when *not* following the rule that name and formControlName must match for radio buttons, trying to set unique names for each set of radios: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-mmods7?devtoolsheight=33&file=src/app/app.component.html **Expected:** The `type` radio buttons oustide of the `meta` FormGroup should be in a different set than the `type` radio buttons in the `meta` FormGroup, such independent selections can be made in each set. No errors are logged. **Actual:** The form behavior works as expected, including the value of the submitted form. Errors are logged (see below). **Expected:** Each book in the `books` FormArray should have an independent set of `status` radio buttons, such that independent selections can be made for each book. No errors are logged. **Actual:** Radios in each book are not given the interpolated `name` value. Both radios for each book can be selected simultaneously. Errors are logged (see below). ## üî• Exception or Error ``` Error: If you define both a name and a formControlName attribute on your radio button, their values must match. Ex: ``` ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

10.0.9
**Anything else relevant?** This was previously raised in #23319 with an attempted fix in #23727.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Reactive Forms rules for name and formControlName matching causes conflicts with radio sets in different FormGroup/FormArray sections" (#40074)

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin</summary>

### [`v7.0.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​700-httpsgithubcomwebpack-contribcopy-webpack-plugincomparev640v700-2020-12-10)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/compare/v6.4.0...v7.0.0)

##### ‚ö† BREAKING CHANGES

-   minimum supported webpack version is `5`
-   the `flatten` option was removed in favor `[name].[ext]` value for the `to` option, 
-   the `transformPath` option was removed in favor `Function` type of the `to` option, look at [examples](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin#function)
-   the `cacheTransform` option was removed in favor `Object` type of the `transform` option, look at [examples](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin#transform)
-   migration on the `compilation.hooks.processAssets` hook
-   empty filtered paths throw an error, you can disable this behaviour using the `noErrorOnMissing` option

### [`v6.4.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​640-httpsgithubcomwebpack-contribcopy-webpack-plugincomparev632v640-2020-12-07)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/compare/v6.3.2...v6.4.0)

##### Features

-   added the `info` option ([db53937](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/commit/db53937016b7dbf494bc728f00242cd26541f6a3))
-   added type `Function` for the `to` option ([#​563](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/issues/563)) ([9bc5416](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/commit/9bc541694c0d0975c59586cedfea4a51d11f5278))

##### [6.3.2](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/compare/v6.3.1...v6.3.2) (2020-11-19)

##### Bug Fixes

-   watching directories ([#​558](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/issues/558)) ([7b58fd9](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/commit/7b58fd9a89e9b29578b30cb3119453e78e036ec2))

##### [6.3.1](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/compare/v6.3.0...v6.3.1) (2020-11-13)

##### Bug Fixes

-   watching ([#​555](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/issues/555)) ([b996923](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/commit/b9969230321df68ed235ed1861729837f234750e))

</details>

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>survivejs/webpack-merge</summary>

### [`v5.7.0`](https://togithub.com/survivejs/webpack-merge/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​570--2020-12-12)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/survivejs/webpack-merge/compare/v5.6.1...v5.7.0)

-   Feat - Throw a `TypeError` if trying to use `mergeWithRules` with invalid configuration types for `append`/`prepend`/`merge` operations.

### [`v5.6.1`](https://togithub.com/survivejs/webpack-merge/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​561--2020-12-11)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/survivejs/webpack-merge/compare/v5.6.0...v5.6.1)

-   Fix - Drop extraneous logging.

### [`v5.6.0`](https://togithub.com/survivejs/webpack-merge/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​560--2020-12-11)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/survivejs/webpack-merge/compare/v5.5.0...v5.6.0)

-   Feat - Support `merge` (`CustomizeRule.Merge`) for objects at `mergeWithRules`. This is useful for merging loader options for example. [#​163](https://togithub.com/survivejs/webpack-merge/issues/163)

### [`v5.5.0`](https://togithub.com/survivejs/webpack-merge/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​550--2020-12-10)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/survivejs/webpack-merge/compare/v5.4.1...v5.5.0)

-   Feat - Allow `mergeWithRules` to merge based on rules without a match. [#​151](https://togithub.com/survivejs/webpack-merge/issues/151) [#​159](https://togithub.com/survivejs/webpack-merge/issues/159)

### [`v5.4.1`](https://togithub.com/survivejs/webpack-merge/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​541--2020-12-08)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/survivejs/webpack-merge/compare/v5.4.0...v5.4.1)

-   Fix - Allow `mergeUnique` to work with arbitrary order. [#​161](https://togithub.com/survivejs/webpack-merge/issues/161)

</details>

Issues.Title: Angular build no longer compiles nested scss while serve does
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: I added new components and I wanted to build it as usual but it does not works as expected. I noticed _@angular-devkit/build-angular_ was updated from ^0.1001.0 to ^0.1100.3 but even when I downgrade it nothing changes. ### Description As explained I added new components and I tested them with _ng serve_ (npm run start cfr. stackblitz) and all the nested scss were successfully compiled. Then I ran a new build (npm run build-i18n cfr. stackblitz) but unlike before and the serve, the nested scss were not compiled (they are not present in the browser developer console). ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Please find as a minimal reproduction a [StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-a4bwgr) which works (StackBlitz logically uses serve?). ## üåç Your Environment 



Angular CLI: 10.2.0
Node: 12.18.3
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 10.1.0
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, localize, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                            Version
------------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect          0.1001.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular      0.1100.4
@angular-devkit/core               10.1.0
@angular-devkit/schematics         10.2.0
@angular/cdk                       10.2.0
@angular/cli                       10.2.0
@angular/flex-layout               10.0.0-beta.32
@angular/material                  10.2.0
@angular/material-moment-adapter   10.2.0
@nguniversal/builders              10.1.0
@nguniversal/express-engine        10.1.0
@schematics/angular                10.2.0
@schematics/update                 0.1002.0
rxjs                               6.6.3
typescript                         4.0.2
webpack                            4.44.1
I hope to be clear enough otherwise tell me ;) Thank you!

postcss/postcss ### [`v8.2.1`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​821) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.2.0...8.2.1) - Fixed `Node#toJSON()` and `postcss.fromJSON()` (by Niklas Mischkulnig). ### [`v8.2.0`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/releases/8.2.0) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.1.14...8.2.0) PostCSS 8.2 added a new API to serialize and deserialize CSS AST to JSON. ```js import { parse, fromJSON } from 'postcss' let root = parse('a{}', { from: 'input.css' }) let json = root.toJSON() // save to file, send by network, etc let root2 = fromJSON(json) ``` Thanks to [@​mischnic](https://togithub.com/mischnic) for [his work](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/pull/1484). ### [`v8.1.14`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​8114) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.1.13...8.1.14) - Fixed parser performance regression. ### [`v8.1.13`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​8113) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.1.12...8.1.13) - Fixed broken AST after moving nodes in visitor API. ### [`v8.1.12`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​8112) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.1.11...8.1.12) - Fixed Autoprefixer regression. ### [`v8.1.11`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​8111) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.1.10...8.1.11) - Added PostCSS update suggestion on unknown event in plugin.

Issues.Body:
[![WhiteSource Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com) This PR contains the following updates: | Package | Change | Age | Adoption | Passing | Confidence | |---|---|---|---|---|---| | [autoprefixer](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer) | [`10.0.4` -> `10.1.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/autoprefixer/10.0.4/10.1.0) | [![age](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/autoprefixer/10.1.0/age-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![adoption](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/autoprefixer/10.1.0/adoption-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![passing](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/autoprefixer/10.1.0/compatibility-slim/10.0.4)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![confidence](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/autoprefixer/10.1.0/confidence-slim/10.0.4)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | --- ### Release Notes
postcss/autoprefixer ### [`v10.1.0`](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer/releases/10.1.0) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer/compare/10.0.4...10.1.0) Autoprefixer 10.1 improved `min-resolution` support. [@​infusion](https://togithub.com/infusion) added `dpcm` unit support and `num2fraction` with [Fraction.js](https://togithub.com/infusion/Fraction.js/), which uses Farey Sequences as a rational approximation (more precise) and simplifies the fraction using continued fractions to …õ <0.001 afterward. ```css /* input */ @​media (min-resolution: 113.38dpcm) { ‚Ä¶ } /* output */ @​media (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 3), (min--moz-device-pixel-ratio: 3), (-o-min-device-pixel-ratio: 3/1), (min-resolution: 113.38dpcm) { ‚Ä¶ } ```

Issues.Title: ng build --prod=true fails with global scripts in agular.json when opt-in to Webpack 5
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? This works when not opting-in to Webpack 5. ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... --> If scripts are specified in the build options to be included globally, `ng build --prod=true` fails to build. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. create a new angular project 2. opt-in to webpack 5 : `"resolutions": { "webpack": "5.4.0" }` 3. add an external dependency such as jquery to package.json (using yarn) `yarn add jquery` 4. update angular.json to include the new global dependency 

  "projects": {
    "wp5": {
      "projectType": "application",
      "schematics": {},
      "root": "",
      "sourceRoot": "src",
      "prefix": "app",
      "architect": {
        "build": {
          "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser",
          "options": {
            "outputPath": "dist/wp5",
            "index": "src/index.html",
            "main": "src/main.ts",
            "polyfills": "src/polyfills.ts",
            "tsConfig": "tsconfig.app.json",
            "aot": true,
            "assets": [
              "src/favicon.ico",
              "src/assets"
            ],
            "styles": [
              "src/styles.css"
            ],
            "scripts": [
              "./node_modules/jquery/dist/jquery.min.js"
            ]
          }
     ...
   }
5. run `ng build --prod=true` ## üî• Exception or Error 



wp5 % ng build --prod=true
‚úî Browser application bundle generation complete.
An unhandled exception occurred: Chunk.modulesIterableThere was no ChunkGraph assigned to the Chunk for backward-compat (Use the new API)
See "/private/var/folders/km/qmp0wv016q9chrhmsr34qdp80000gn/T/ng-zRypdH/angular-errors.log" for further details.
## üåç Your Environment 



Angular CLI: 11.0.4
Node: 15.3.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 11.0.3
... animations, common, compiler, core, forms, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                         Version

@angular-devkit/architect       0.1101.0-next.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1101.0-next.2
@angular-devkit/core            11.0.4
@angular-devkit/schematics      11.0.4
@angular/cli                    11.0.4
@angular/compiler-cli           11.0.4
@schematics/angular             11.0.4
@schematics/update              0.1100.4
rxjs                            6.6.3
typescript                      4.0.5

Issues.Title: build: update ini to version 1.3.6
Issues.Body:
[![WhiteSource Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com)

This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Change | Age | Adoption | Passing | Confidence |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| [ini](https://togithub.com/isaacs/ini) | [`1.3.5` -> `1.3.6`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/ini/1.3.5/1.3.6) | [![age](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/ini/1.3.6/age-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![adoption](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/ini/1.3.6/adoption-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![passing](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/ini/1.3.6/compatibility-slim/1.3.5)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![confidence](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/ini/1.3.6/confidence-slim/1.3.5)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) |

### GitHub Vulnerability Alerts

#### [GHSA-qqgx-2p2h-9c37](https://togithub.com/npm/ini/commit/56d2805e07ccd94e2ba0984ac9240ff02d44b6f1)

### Overview
The `ini` npm package before version 1.3.6 has a Prototype Pollution vulnerability.

If an attacker submits a malicious INI file to an application that parses it with `ini.parse`, they will pollute the prototype on the application. This can be exploited further depending on the context.

### Patches

This has been patched in 1.3.6

### Steps to reproduce

payload.ini
```
[__proto__]
polluted = "polluted"
```

poc.js:
```
var fs = require('fs')
var ini = require('ini')

var parsed = ini.parse(fs.readFileSync('./payload.ini', 'utf-8'))
console.log(parsed)
console.log(parsed.__proto__)
console.log(polluted)
```

```
> node poc.js
{}
{ polluted: 'polluted' }
{ polluted: 'polluted' }
polluted
```

---

Issues.Title: Control what gets generated - Transpilation/Compilation Time version of *ngIf
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request I haven't find a way to control how to disable part of the generated code with angular. Here a more in depth description of the feature that I'm looking for: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/65020209/control-what-gets-generated-transpilation-compilation-time-version-of-ngif ### Description To sum up, this is what I'm looking for: ``` #define version admin User stuff #if version==admin Admin stuff
#endif ``` So from the same code bases I can generate two different apps. This is also useful for testing and there are more usecases. Maybe there is away to already achieve this, but I haven't been able to find it. Is this something interesting to add in the future?

Issues.Title: bug(mat-select): Support for selection through Alpha/Numeric keys broken
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

It seems that the support for skipping to a select item by typing, similar to the native select in MatSelect has been removed in recent updates. This support was added in https://github.com/angular/components/pull/2907

Steps to reproduce:

Open https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-a9vnec?file=src/app/select-custom-trigger-example.html

Set focus on the select list and quickly press few keys corresponding to a country name for example just type PAK, ideally it should set focus on Pakistan, but you will notice the focus is set to a new list item after each key press and you will end up selecting Kazakhstan from the list.
 
#### Expected Behavior

`mat-select` should support skipping to a select item by typing, a behavior similar to the native select.

It's really helpful especially in case of large lists.

#### Actual Behavior

Although pressing any key takes user to the first element of the list that starts with that key but quickly pressing subsequent key doesn't further filter the selection.

#### Environment

- Angular:11.0.3
- CDK/Material:11.0.2
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-select): Support for selection through Alpha/Numeric keys broken" (#21343)

Issues.Title: build: clean up some internal deprecated API usages
Issues.Body:
* Replaces usages of the deprecated `browser.rootEl` with `browser.angularAppRoot`.
* Fixes a couple of places that were using `async` instead of `waitForAsync`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: clean up some internal deprecated API usages" (#21342)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/mdc-select): panel losing max-height if menu is opened after select
Issues.Body:
If an MDC-based `mat-menu` is opened after a `mat-select`, the select will lose its `max-height`, because its selector specificity is too low and it gets overwritten by the menu which uses the same set of mixins.

These changes resolve the issue by increasing the specificity.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material-experimental/mdc-select): panel losing max-height if menu is opened after select" (#21341)

Issues.Body: When page loads for the first time Roboto font that has different font weight e.g 700, 900 moves or scales into place
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Roboto font moves issue" (#21340)

Issues.Title: fix(material/sort): animation not working correctly when activated on focus
Issues.Body:
The sort header arrow animation wasn't working correctly when it was triggered as a result of a focus/blur.
I'm marking this as a potential accessibility issue, because it prevents keyboard users from seeing what their potential sorted state would be.

Here's what it looks like at the moment:
![demo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4450522/102010430-4207b480-3d3e-11eb-9caf-141abf33c941.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/sort): animation not working correctly when activated on focus" (#21339)

Issues.Title: fix(material/table): unsubscribe from source when disconnecting
Issues.Body:
* Fixes that the table data source wasn't unsubscribing from sorting, pagination etc. when it is disconnected.
* Adds a bit of logic to properly support re-connecting the same date source again.
* Fixes up a couple of issues in the unit test setup which could cause state to leak between tests.

Fixes #21270.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/table): unsubscribe from source when disconnecting" (#21338)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-dialog): dialog has a scroll in Chrome 88
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: 
- Components: https://stackblitz.com/angular/qkjllvpjrrer?file=src%2Fapp%2Fdialog-overview-example.ts


Steps to reproduce:
1.  Open link https://material.angular.io/components/dialog/overview in Chrome 88
2.  Click "Pick one"
3. Observe scroll in the dialog
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
No scroll in the dialog
Open in Chrome 87 see no scroll.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
There is a scroll present in the dialog
This may be an issue in Chrome rendering.

#### Environment

- Angular: 11.0.4, 10.1.0
- CDK/Material: 11.0.2 , 10.2.7
- Browser(s): Version 88.0.4324.41 (Official Build) beta (64-bit) ,  Version 87.0.4280.88 (Official Build) (64-bit)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Windows 10, Ubuntu 20.10


Chrome 87 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15310395/101983074-15da2e00-3c81-11eb-8f81-2392149f4f92.png)

Chrome 88 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15310395/101983077-1ffc2c80-3c81-11eb-936b-b40a4d83b9e6.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-dialog): dialog has a scroll in Chrome 88" (#21337)

Issues.Title: docs(material/dialog): state when notification observables close
Issues.Body:
It's currently not stated if and when the notification observables from `MatDialogRef` are closed. This causes questions and discussions both online and offline (in my team at work to be precise).

See different answers and comments in:
- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/58198544/angular-dialogref-unsubscribe-do-i-need-to-unsubscribe-from-afterclosed, 
- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42343072/how-to-subscribe-to-angularmaterial-dialog-afterclosed/53556855

I think this matter should be mentioned in the documentation.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "docs(material/dialog): state when notification observables close" (#21336)

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/scrolling): virtual scroll not picking up trackBy function when items come in after init
Issues.Body:
The virtual scroll only creates its `IterableDiffer` once, which means that if the `trackBy` function comes in at a later point (e.g. the input changed or the initialization order is different), it won't be picked up.

These changes make it so the differ always has a `trackBy` which then delegates to the user-provided one or falls back to the default.

Fixes #21281.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(cdk/scrolling): virtual scroll not picking up trackBy function when items come in after init" (#21335)

Issues.Title: fix(material/slider): incorrectly inheriting color when nested inside component with theme
Issues.Body:
The slider theme selectors were a bit too broad which meant that it would automatically inherit the colors from a parent component, if the Material theming classes were used somewhere up the chain (e.g. a slider inside a tab group).

These changes use more specific selectors to avoid the issue.

Fixes #21271.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/slider): incorrectly inheriting color when nested inside component with theme" (#21334)
